  16. (* Handling of sections in bytecode executable files *)

  18. module Name = struct

  20.   type raw_name = string

  22.   type t =
  23.     | CODE (** bytecode *)
  24.     | CRCS (** crcs for modules *)
  25.     | DATA (** global data (constant) *)
  26.     | DBUG (** debug info *)
  27.     | DLLS (** dll names *)
  28.     | DLPT (** dll paths *)
  29.     | PRIM (** primitives names *)
  30.     | RNTM (** The path to the bytecode interpreter (use_runtime mode) *)
  31.     | SYMB (** global identifiers *)
  32.     | Other of raw_name

  34.   let of_string name =
  35.     match name with
  36.     | "CODE" -> CODE
  37.     | "DLPT" -> DLPT
  38.     | "DLLS" -> DLLS
  39.     | "DATA" -> DATA
  40.     | "PRIM" -> PRIM
  41.     | "SYMB" -> SYMB
  42.     | "DBUG" -> DBUG
  43.     | "CRCS" -> CRCS
  44.     | "RNTM" -> RNTM
  45.     | name   ->
  46.         if String.length name <> 4 then
  47.           invalid_arg "Bytesections.Name.of_string: must be of size 4";
  48.         Other name

  50.   let to_string = function
  51.     | CODE -> "CODE"
  52.     | DLPT -> "DLPT"
  53.     | DLLS -> "DLLS"
  54.     | DATA -> "DATA"
  55.     | PRIM -> "PRIM"
  56.     | SYMB -> "SYMB"
  57.     | DBUG -> "DBUG"
  58.     | CRCS -> "CRCS"
  59.     | RNTM -> "RNTM"
  60.     | Other n -> n
  61. end

  63. ‌type section_entry = {
  64.   name : Name.t;
  65.   pos  : int;
  66.   len  : int;
  67. }

  69. ‌type section_table = {
  70.    sections : section_entry list;
  71.    first_pos : int
  72. }

  74. (* Recording sections *)
  75. ‌type toc_writer = {
  76.   (* List of all sections, in reverse order *)
  77.   mutable section_table_rev : section_entry list;
  78.   mutable section_prev : int;
  79.   outchan : out_channel;
  80. }

  82. ‌let init_record outchan : toc_writer =
  83.   let pos = pos_out outchan in
  84.   { section_prev = pos;
  85.     section_table_rev = [];
  86.     outchan }

  88. let record t name =
  89.   let pos = pos_out t.outchan in
  90.   if pos < t.section_prev then
  91.     invalid_arg "Bytesections.record: out_channel offset moved backward";
  92.   let entry = {name; pos = t.section_prev; len = pos - t.section_prev} in
  93.   t.section_table_rev <- entry :: t.section_table_rev;
  94.   t.section_prev <- pos

  96. let write_toc_and_trailer t =
  97.   let section_table = List.rev t.section_table_rev in
  98.   List.iter
  99.     (fun {name; pos = _; len} ->
  100.        let name = Name.to_string name in
  101.        assert (String.length name = 4);
  102.       output_string t.outchan name; output_binary_int t.outchan len)
  103.     section_table;
  104.   output_binary_int t.outchan (List.length section_table);
  105.   output_string t.outchan Config.exec_magic_number

  107. (* Read the table of sections from a bytecode executable *)

  109. exception Bad_magic_number

  111. let read_toc ic =
  112.   let pos_trailer = in_channel_length ic - 16 in
  113.   seek_in ic pos_trailer;
  114.   let num_sections = input_binary_int ic in
  115.   let header =
  116.     really_input_string ic (String.length Config.exec_magic_number)
  117.   in
  118.   if header <> Config.exec_magic_number then raise Bad_magic_number;
  119.   let toc_pos = pos_trailer - 8 * num_sections in
  120.   seek_in ic toc_pos;
  121.   let section_table_rev = ref [] in
  122.   for _i = 1 to num_sections do
  123.     let name = Name.of_string (really_input_string ic 4) in
  124.     let len = input_binary_int ic in
  125.     section_table_rev := (name, len) :: !section_table_rev
  126.   done;
  127.   let first_pos, sections =
  128.     List.fold_left (fun (pos, l) (name, len) ->
  129.         let section = {name; pos = pos - len; len} in
  130.         (pos - len, section :: l)) (toc_pos, []) !section_table_rev
  131.   in
  132.   { sections; first_pos }

  134. let all t = t.sections

  136. let pos_first_section t = t.first_pos

  138. let find_section t name =
  139.   let rec find = function
  140.     | [] -> raise Not_found
  141.     | {name = n; pos; len} :: rest ->
  142.         if n = name
  143.         then pos, len
  144.         else find rest
  145.   in find t.sections

  147. (* Position ic at the beginning of the section named "name",
  148.    and return the length of that section.  Raise Not_found if no
  149.    such section exists. *)

  151. let seek_section t ic name =
  152.   let pos, len = find_section t name in
  153.   seek_in ic pos; len

  155. (* Return the contents of a section, as a string *)

  157. let read_section_string t ic name =
  158.   really_input_string ic (seek_section t ic name)

  160. (* Return the contents of a section, as marshalled data *)

  162. let read_section_struct t ic name =
  163.   ignore (seek_section t ic name);
  164.   input_value ic
